Comment 2: 
While I could write a pure Go version, personally I would prefer to use the native
functions for wildcard expansion. There are differences in the interpretation of certain
things between Windows and POSIX-like platforms (example: expansion of the tilde to mean
$HOME), and I would not want Go programs to use different rules for the expansion than
everything else.

That said, the most urgent need for a Glob function is on Windows for decoding file name
arguments, thus the Win32-only function should be fine.
